ovdesc.p: This property class represents the CR.CARD product for the module AZ in T24. This property class is used for classic products.

desc.p: This field should be read along with the field AMT.PERCENT.

Input in this field indicates the product is RANGED Revolving type. It is a multi value set. The field Highest Range can take only amount which implies the range. Each drawals is taken and is matched with the range within which it falls. The %age or the amount specified in the range under amt. percent field is applied to arrive at the CC amount.

(1) A '*', before the numeric entered in AMT.PERCENT is must or else the system will deem it as amount and will generate CC schedule for only USD10 and not 10% of the outstanding.

(2) A 'B*100', implies '100% of the balance in the acct'. This is because when the outstanding in a sub acct falls within this range then it is obvious that as per the minimum class an amount of 100000 is payable. However, if the outstanding in the acct is 98573 in that case CC schedule amount will be more than the outstanding that is actually payable if we stick to the concept of 100000 minimum. To obviate this we have introduced the concept 100% of the balance outstanding or 100000.

(3) The fields Highest Range and Amt. Percent can be multi valued to specify different ranges. Amt. Percent field can be input either with a %age or an amount. A sub acct indicating a draw down is taken and is matched for a range within which it falls and the %age specified in the amt. percent field for that range is applied. If the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount the system doesn't calculate any %age, but takes the amount as the 'CC' amount.
For ex:
(1) Reference to the table, if the amount of draw down in a sub a/c comes to 250000 then it falls within the range of 300000 hence attracts 10% of the range as the 'CC' amount.
(2) Similarly, if the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 500000 then it attracts a flat amount of 250000 instead of any % age since the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount.

(3) If the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 600000, since there is no range within which it falls it automatically attracts the revolving %age for generation of 'CC' schedule amount, which in the present case (refer table) will be 10%.
VALIDATIONS
Input allowed only if the Repayment Type is Ranged Revolving.
Allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of products.

For CREDIT CARD type of products this field indicates if PD has to be created during COB on the schedule dates if the repay account has insufficient funds.
If set as 'YES' then PD will be created during COB, else PD will have to created through a online payment beyond the schedule date.
This field is valid only for CREDIT CARD type of products.
This field is allowed only if PD.LINK.TO.AZ.is set to 'YES'.
Allowed values are 'YES', 'NO', ''. 'NO' and '' are considered to be the same.

For credit cards, system has to settles first by date wise and then by component wise. Hence related PD.PARAMETER should have REPAYMENT.METHOD as '3' and only the following components are settled by AZ and in the order REPAYMENT.ORDER as A1,TX,A2,PE,PS,IN,PR
For any repayment type if the GENERATION of CC schedules (principal repayment schedule) is to be postponed then this field is used.
Input permitted in this field is Numeric and it should be read along with the frequency input in the repay date field of card issue application.
When a card issue frequency is monthly and input made in this field is 3, it means for 3 months the generation of CC schedule is to be postponed, i.e., NO CC schedule is generated.
If in card issue the frequency is weekly then it is to be interpreted that 'CC' schedules will not be generated for 3 weeks.

For a Non Redemption type, input in this field is mandatory. This is for the reason that in Non Redemption type CI (interest) schedules are generated regularly and the Principal (CC schedules) repayment is made in one BULLET payment.
VALIDATIONS
Input allowed only if the Repayment Type is a Non redemption

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.

This field decides how a repayment received should be apportioned among the various withdrawals made under a Credit Card account.
Permitted inputs are (1) Proportionate and (2) FIFO [First in First Out].
TO ILLUSTRATE: -
Suppose there are 3 draws through sub a/c
Withdrawal 1
Withdrawal 2
Withdrawal 3
TOTAL
Appropriation Type- Proportionate
If the repayment received, is 125000 the set-off will be 125000*350000/1250000
Appropriation Type- FIFO
If on the other hand the repayment received is, say 450000 and type is FIFO then: -

First withdrawal of 350000 will be fully adjusted and then remaining amount of 100000 will be adjusted towards the O/s of second withdrawal. This way it will continue until the last drawl is met with fully.
VALIDATIONS:
Input can be either Proportionate or FIFO.
Input is subject to change.
